thread.title: Wilko fined £2.2m over worker crushed by metal cage
thread.title_full: Wilko fined £2.2m over worker crushed by metal cage

title: Wilko fined £2.2m over worker crushed by metal cage
text:
Wilko fined £2.2m over worker crushed by metal cage 11 January 2017 Close share panel Image caption Corisande Collins said her injuries would not stop her achieving in life National chain store Wilko has been fined £2.2m after a worker was crushed and left paralysed. 
Corisande Collins, 23, from Glenfield, was pinned beneath a metal cage full of paint while she was working at a store in Leicester in 2013. 
Ms Collins, who was working part-time while studying for a degree, now uses a wheelchair. 
Leicester Crown Court heard the company admitted failing to ensure the health and safety of its employees.
